property.name: description
property.value: Simple security settings to restrict access to transactional methods (InsertSensor, InsertObservation, etc.). Users requiring more control over security should use 52°North WSS.

property.name: description
property.value: Activate/Deactivate transactional security support. If true, allowed IPs or token should be defined! If allowed IPs and/or authorization token are defined, then incoming transactional requests are checked against them.

property.name: description
property.value: Comma separated ranges of IPs that should be allowed to make transactional requests. Use CIDR notation or raw IP addresses (e.g. 127.0.0.1,192.168.0.0/16). Subnet notation is also supported (e.g. 192.168.0.0/255.255.0.0). Leading zeros are not allowed.

property.name: description
property.value: Comma seperated list of allowed proxy IP addresses. These will be used to authorize allowed transactional IP addresses behind proxy servers.

property.name: description
property.value: Authorization token to require for transactional requests. Specified in the HTTP Authorization header (Authorization: {token}).
